授業目的: This course is designed to enhance Academic English proficiency through the study of cross‐cultural communication. Emphasis is placed on exploring the differences and interactions between Japanese and Western cultural practices and values. Students will engage with authentic English texts and scholarly materials, develop critical thinking, and hone their ability to research and present cultural analyses.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
1. Analyze Cross-Cultural Communication: Critically examine English texts and research related to cross‐cultural communication, with an emphasis on comparing Japanese and Western cultural perspectives.
2. Engage in Scholarly Discussion: Participate in group discussions that explore cultural differences and sociological perspectives, fostering a deeper understanding of intercultural dynamics.
3. Conduct Research: Identify, investigate, and analyze topics in cross-cultural communication using appropriate research methods.
4. Present Research Findings: Develop and deliver an 8‑minute multimedia presentation that clearly communicates their research findings. Instructors may also opt for a brief written report (e.g., 500–1000 words) to complement the presentation.
5. Integrate Multiple Perspectives: Synthesize information from various sources to support arguments and draw informed conclusions about cultural interactions.
授業方法: Classes are conducted face-to-face in the classroom.

トピック.授業計画1:
Lessons held in the computer lab will be focused on research and writing for the final essay and presentation. Lessons held in normal classrooms will be for lectures, group discussions, and textbook activities.
Skills that will be highlighted in this course:
synthesizing information; quoting, paraphrasing, and summarizing, supporting opinions with facts and statistics, critical thinking, research skills, basic APA citation format, avoiding plagiarism, gathering data through field research
トピック.授業外学習2: Students must be highly motivated to succeed in this course. The will need to research, read, and prepare discussions for authentic English texts outside of class. Students must also work on their own research papers for homework.
